snippet: As the administration seeks a way to get an Obama nominee confirmed to the Export-Import Bank’s board, Apple plans to unveil new versions of the Apple Watch and the iPhone.

headline.main: White House Pushes for Export-Import Bank Deal as Apple Readies iPhone Update
headline.print_headline: U.S. Seeks Bank Deal, and Apple Preps iPhone

snippet: The European Commission denies that its shock demand that Apple Inc. hand 13 billion euros in back taxes to Ireland is, in the pungent phrase of Apple CEO Tim Cook, "total political crap".

headline.main: Political? Mais Oui, of Course, EU Insiders Say of Apple Case
headline.print_headline: Political? Mais Oui, of Course, EU Insiders Say of Apple Case

snippet: U.S. President Barack Obama said on Monday that the United States had to move in concert with other countries on the issue of tax avoidance, as some U.S. allies were "racing to the bottom" with their tax policies.

headline.main: Obama Says Countries Must Move in Concert on Tax Avoidance
headline.print_headline: Obama Says Countries Must Move in Concert on Tax Avoidance

snippet: German Finance Minister Wolfgang Schaeuble on Monday said the G20 leaders agreed that the BEPS process to crack down on tax "base erosion and profit sharing" was working and further steps were needed to implement it, including in the digital econo...

headline.main: German Finance Minister Lauds Efforts to Crack Down on Tax Evasion
headline.print_headline: German Finance Minister Lauds Efforts to Crack Down on Tax Evasion

snippet: The European Commission will meet consumer groups this week to make sure they are doing enough to seek compensation for European drivers affected by Volkswagen's cheating of diesel emissions tests.

headline.main: EU Seeks to Coordinate Consumer Action Against Volkswagen Over Dieselgate
headline.print_headline: EU Seeks to Coordinate Consumer Action Against Volkswagen Over Dieselgate

snippet: The entrepreneur Tristan Walker has introduced an electric trimmer designed especially for black men. Now a famous fellow Queens native is on board.
abstract: Hip-hop artist Nas, in his latest album, praises Bevel blade, electric trimmer designed to help black men and others with coarse hair avoid razor burn or ingrown hairs; tech entrepreneur Tristan Walker developed product and convinced rapper to become investor in his Walker & Company startup.

headline.main: A Budding Beauty Baron Gets an Assist From Nas
headline.print_headline: An Entrepreneur Gains a Fan in Nas

snippet: Apart from its snow-white marble floors and soaring features, the new Westfield World Trade Center looks like a mall that could be just about anywhere.
abstract: David W Dunlap Building Blocks column shares experience of first visit to Westfield World Trade Center shopping mall inside World Trade Center's plaza's Oculus hall; says while it is heartening to see crowds teeming through soaring hall at last, it is dispiriting to find no indication of consecrated ground on which structure sits; contends significant role played by Westfield American in redevelopment of property should have been early clue that end result would be shopping mall that could be located anywhere in America.

headline.main: A Shopping Mall at Ground Zero, Uninformed by Its Sacred Land
headline.print_headline: At Ground Zero, a Mall Uninformed by Its Sacred Land

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey

snippet: Angered by the cultural transformations of the 1960s, Mrs. Schlafly led grass-roots campaigns against Communism, abortion and the Equal Rights Amendment.

headline.main: Phyllis Schlafly, ‘First Lady’ of a Political March to the Right, Dies at 92
headline.print_headline: Phyllis Schlafly Dies at 92; Helped Steer the United States to the Right
